article: Mars is not, it seems, the dry old planet we once believed it to be .Astronauts who are _ to go there in the next decade may find plenty _ water to slake their thirst.And with water present the _ of finding some sort of life of Mars are _ brighter.   This is the view of forty geologists who have been analyzing thousands of pictures and other scientific _ obtained by robot explorers in the sixties and seventies.   To begin with, scientists thought the Red planet was as _ as the Moon _ dust storms swirling over vast sandy _ .But now the picture is very different _ mountains and valleys carved by _ glaciers and rivers rushing and rumbling deep underground.   In a report on the analysis of the Martian pictures Dr.Michael Car of the U.S.Geological Survey comments: "I am convinced _ lots of water on Mars." Any surface water will be in the _ of ice.But it could save explorers from _ to take so much _ with them.   The report says _ Mars probably had a warmer climate in ages _ due to its axis having been more tilted towards the sun. 19 _ signs of plant or animal life have been detected by instruments landed on Mars, _ the landing vehicles have been sent there for a few years.
